summary: Completed testing of Monday.com Stock Approval Column feature. Fixed 1 frontend bug (stock_approval_column_id not being loaded into config state). All 7 backend tests pass. Frontend now correctly shows Stock Approval Column Active status with column ID.
passed_tests: Backend: POST /api/store/monday/txb-inventory/setup-stock-approval creates or finds column (returns column_id and status='already_exists' or 'created')
Backend: Config has column_id populated after setup
Backend: Stock orders list includes source field for monday_sync orders
Backend: Auth required for stock orders endpoint (401)
Backend: Auth required for setup approval endpoint (401)
Frontend: Stock Movements tab (Unatienda > Stock Mov.) loads correctly
Frontend: Catalog filter tabs visible (All 12, School Textbooks 10, Public Store 2)
Frontend: Summary cards show Total Orders (12), Pending (7), Completed (5)
Frontend: Catalog badges (Textbooks/Public) display on order rows
Frontend: Order Detail dialog shows catalog type badge and Inventory field
Frontend: TXB Inventory tab in Integraciones shows Stock Approval Control card
Frontend: Stock Approval Column Active status displayed with Column ID: color_mm0mtf8f
critical_code_review_comments: FIXED: TxbInventoryTab.jsx was missing stock_approval_column_id in fetchConfig setConfig() call and initial state - now correctly loads and displays column status
context_for_next_testing_agent: Stock Approval Column feature is complete. Key paths: TXB Inventory settings at INTEGRATIONS > Integraciones > TXB Inventory tab. Stock Approval Control card shows column status (Active/Not Configured). Stock approval column_id is 'color_mm0mtf8f'. Monday.com webhook-created orders would have source='monday_sync' and display a Monday.com badge (Zap icon) but none currently exist in the system (webhook events come from Monday.com triggers). Stock Movements tab at Unatienda > Stock Mov. tab shows all stock orders with catalog badges.
rca_of_the_issue: Frontend TxbInventoryTab.jsx was not including stock_approval_column_id when setting config state from API response, causing the UI to always show 'Not Configured' even when the backend had a valid column_id. Fixed by adding stock_approval_column_id to both initial state and setConfig() call.
